subject: Re: OO testing methodology
msgSnippet: Hi I think the test methodology is very much tied to the overroll development methodology. For example, if Agile or Test Driven approach is followed, the
messageBody:
Hi

I think the test methodology is very much tied to the overroll
development methodology. For example, if Agile or Test Driven
approach is followed, the approach of testing is already defined. RUP
and CMMI also have defined their way of testing.

So this has to be discussed rogether with the development team.

Jirong


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Maly, Daniel" <daniel.maly@c...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> This may not be the best user group for my post, but I believe the
unit
> testing experts will have an answer:
>
> I'm looking for a formal testing methodology/process to accompany
and
> precede our unit testing harness - on the development side of SDLC.
An
> approach that unifies requirements testing, software design testing
and
> implementation testing.
>
> Any information is very appreciated.
>
> Thank You,
> Best Regards,
>
> Daniel
